question: Which of the following is the name given to the common currency for the members of the Common Market in Europe?
explanation: A common currency for the members of the Common Market in Europe is known as Eurodollar. Eurodollars are time deposits denominated in U.S. dollars at banks outside the United States, and thus are not under the jurisdiction of the Federal Reserve. Consequently, such deposits are subject to much less regulation than similar deposits within the U.S.
